abstract: Despite the effects of the recession, a passion for art among owners of major buildings keeps fresh work in the lobbies.
snippet: Despite the effects of the recession, a passion for art among owners of major buildings keeps fresh work in the lobbies.
lead_paragraph: The practice of adorning New York real estate with major sculptures and other artwork stretches back at least as far as the 1930s. And even during today’s tough economic times, the tradition is holding up. A number of major works of art have been installed in Midtown Manhattan in the last few months.

headline.main: In the Loftiest of Buildings, High Art Still Finds a Home
headline.print_headline: In the Loftiest of Buildings, High Art Still Finds a Home
